title: Erigon syncing on restart and then notifying 1-20 minutes behind
body:
Erigon version: erigon version 2.42.0-stable

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
Linux amd64

Server specs:
128 gb ram, 3 tb ssd, 1 Gbit/s

Commit hash: release

Erigon Command (with flags/config): /root/.erigon/erigon/build/bin/erigon --torrent.download.rate=500mb --torrent.upload.rate=200mb --private.api.addr=0.0.0.0:9090 --http=false


Chain/Network: Mainnet

If i restart erigon, it will fully sync to the current block.
After a few minutes it will get stuck on one block.
Then after a few minutes it will sync until about 3-10 blocks behind the current block.
And this will repeat and repeat.

i also read about other issues where the node is getting out of sync but none of them fit my issue. This is why i opened a new one.

Referenced issues: #7269 #7077 


> Seeing the same issue on Linux Amd64 (Debian 11) 32 RAM 24 CPUs, 3 TB SSD

Whats your golang version?

I will leave another comment tomorrow but i think i solved the issue by myself.

I installed this version `git clone --recurse-submodules -j8 https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon.git`

And i updated golang to 1.20 (It was 1.12 and too old for erigon)

I think it was the old golang version but we will see if it fully works tomorrow.

@timmsGithub your logs are similar to other issues reported, it is just that there are no current fixes, afaik. Compared to using an external CL, I believe Erigon's internal CL is not really production ready yet. Initial sync works very well, but keeping up with the latest block, not so great yet.

UPD: didnt help

So it luckly solved the problem like mentioned above.

If you have these errors maybe play around with different versions from erigon. 

(Just delete the erigon build and download a new one)

I don't think this will solve the problem for the most people but you can try.
Fixed it, too. Built the image from `devel` branch and ran with `--internalcl` flag

@roflganker I believe the devel branch has changed it from opt-out to opt-in for using the internal client, likely because the internal client is not ready to be made the default CL, until all the sync issues have been ironed out...

Do I need to erase my datadir and start fresh? I'm getting this error and updated to `devel` with `--inernalcl`.

I think there's just a problem with the logs when it starts to index? For the longest time only p2p and txpool stat would show.
